definition: to resist/imperial/(classical) to drive (a chariot)/to manage/to govern

sentences.english: He who would lead must first command himself.
sentences.chinese: 欲領導他人的人必須先統御自己。

sentences.english: Qingdafu is the largest-scale noble class under the leadership of the king.
sentences.chinese: 卿大夫家族是國君統御之下規模最大的貴族階層。

sentences.english: Did this crisis stem from a governance failure?
sentences.chinese: 這個危機源自於統御領導的失敗嗎？

sentences.english: Men find and produce their nature for dominance via women.
sentences.chinese: 男人通過統御女人來找到並創造他們的天性。

sentences.english: If they listen to my techniques of management of troops, he can control the whole army as well.
sentences.chinese: 如果能聽從我的統御方法，就可以駕馭三軍之衆。

sentences.english: Leadership can't really be taught. It can only be learned.
sentences.chinese: 領導統御事實上無法傳授，它只能被學習。

sentences.english: He who uses this sword can overwhelm marquis and rule all countries.
sentences.chinese: 使用此劍者可以降伏諸候，統御天下。

definition: to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: to whisper to one another's ear
the trick of injuring oneself to gain the enemy's confidence/CL:條|条[tiao2]
to have no sense of shame/brazen
One-China principle, the official doctrine that Taiwan is a province of China
